GameItemType.Description: A strong oak spear, sharpened to a deadly point.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: This spear is short enough to be wielded with one hand, leaving the other free for a shield.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: The point pierces armor, and the chill seeps through flesh and bone.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: The point pierces armor, and the chill seeps through flesh and bone.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: A Boar Spear has two "wings" behind the blade to keep enraged boars from charging up the spear and attacking the wielder (Trogs have been known to do the same).

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: Krax weaponsmiths forge lighter versions of the boar spear so their soldiers can wield them with shields in battle.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: A deadly weapon for hunting or war.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: "Bring the armorers and make them lay with their creations." - Emperor Karavox after being defeated at the Battle of Spines.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: Also known as the lightning rod, this pike not only unleashes lightning with every attack but helps protect its wielder from the lightning attacks of others.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: Also known as the lightning rod, this pike not only unleashes lightning with every attack but helps protect its wielder from the lightning attacks of others.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

GameItemType.Description: Also known as the firefly bow. Arrows fired from this bow catch fire in the air, often making the arrows appear to jump out of the sky on dark nights.

Arrows fired from this bow immediately chill to dangerously cold temperatures in the air, and leave trails of glimmering supernatural ice crystals, sometimes making the arrows appear to jump out of the sky on dark nights.
This axe smoulders with an internal fire, but when its handle is gripped the blade bursts into flame.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: This head of this axe is covered in a thin coat of rime, but when its handle is gripped the blade bursts into coruscating frostfire.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: The blade of this great axe is set with twin citrines. The amber gemstones look like eyes, and are said to be able to entrance enemies in battle.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: The blade of this great axe is set with twin aquamarines. The pale blue gemstones look like eyes, and are said to be able to entrance enemies in battle.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: Also known as the dragon's breath staff. A torrent of fire can be coaxed out of the flames that continually burn at the staff's tip.
A jet of fire can be coaxed from the embers that eternally burn on the tip of this staff.
When it is worn even the wearer's caress burns those he or she touches. Although some see this as a weapon, the Quendar are known to use it for pleasure.
This ring imbues the wearer's attacks with fire.
